column2: Sentence
column5: Comp Q

column2: The gossipy neighbor heard the story had never actually been true.
column5: Did the story turn out to be false?

column2: The journal editor printed the article had been slanderous to him.
column5: Did the editor approve of the article?

column2: The new house-sitter forgot the key would be under the doormat.
column5: Was this a regular house-sitter?

column2: The newspaper editor advocated the truth needed to be made public.
column5: Did the editor want to reveal the truth?

column2: The scuba diver discovered the wreck was caused by a collision.
column5: Did an accident cause the wreck?

column2: The surgical nurses protested the policies were not fair to the patients.
column5: Were the nurses concerned about the patients?

column2: The talented photographer accepted the money could not be spent yet.
column5: Could the money be spent right away?

column2: The trained referees warned the spectators would probably get too rowdy.
column5: Did people expect the fans to be calm?

column2: The frustrated tourists understood that the message would mean they couldn't go.
column5: Were the tourists happy about the message?

column2: The angry father emphasized that the problems were continuing to get worse.
column5: Were the problems still bad?

column2: The art critic wrote that the interview had not been well received.
column5: Did the interview go over poorly?

column2: The chemistry student learned that the equations could have made measurement more precise.
column5: Was the student in sociology?

column2: The CIA director confirmed that the rumor should have been stopped sooner.
column5: Should the rumor have been better controlled?

column2: The concerned priest asserted that the belief would be hard to explain.
column5: Would the belief be easily explained?

column2: The confident engineer maintained that the machinery would be hard to destroy.
column5: Was the machinery easily ruined?

column2: The French teacher repeated that the poem should be finished by Friday.
column5: Did the teacher instruct French?

column2: The job applicant believed the interviewer had been dishonest with her.
column5: Did the applicant trust the interviewer?

column2: The math whiz figured the sum could be calculated very quickly.
column5: Was the problem going to take long?

column2: The novice plumber realized the mistake would cost him a lot.
column5: Would someone pay for the mistake?

column2: The reading tutor concluded the lesson could be finished very quickly.
column5: Would the lesson be brief?

column2: The rejected bachelor inferred the reason had never been openly stated.
column5: Was the reason openly revealed?

column2: The supply manager indicated the problem would affect the whole office.
column5: Would the problem bother everyone?

column2: The ticket agent admitted the error had been careless and stupid.
column5: Did someone make a stupid mistake?

column2: The union leader implied the raise would keep them from striking.
column5: Would the raise cause a strike?

column2: The film director suggested that the scene should be filmed at night.
column5: Should the scene be shot at noon?

column2: The bus driver worried that the passengers were starting to get annoyed.
column5: Were the passengers comfortable?

column2: The careful scientist proved that the theory had not been properly tested.
column5: Did the scientist doubt the theory?

column2: The class president assumed that the burden would be shared by everyone.
column5: Was the burden to be shared?

column2: The divorce lawyer argued that the issue was irrelevant to the case.
column5: Did the lawyer specialize in divorce?

column2: The experienced judge decided that the appeal should be started right away.
column5: Should the appeal be delayed?

column2: The factory owner suspected that the workers would probably go on strike.
column5: Was there a chance of a strike?

column2: The anonymous informant claimed that the reward did not influence his decision.
column5: Did the informant give his name?

column2: The contestant who offended the host ruined the show for the audience.
column5: Was the show a total success?

column2: The mathematician who addressed the physicist offered the proof at the conference.
column5: Were the scientists working in someone's office?

column2: The diplomat who insulted the congressman ended the negotiations on the spot.
column5: Did the negotiations go well?

column2: The priest who thanked the nun founded the shelter near the church.
column5: Were the priest and nun involved in charity?

column2: The analyst who queried the governor proposed some changes to the plan.
column5: Was the analyst questioned?

column2: The farmer who questioned the expert promoted the product at the fair.
column5: Would the product be promoted on TV?

column2: The official who harassed the manager questioned the policy of lowering wages.
column5: Was the policy being challenged?

column2: The clerk who disliked the director typed the letter to the administration.
column5: Would the administration be receiving a letter?

column2: The guitarist who recommended the band recorded the song for the album.
column5: Did the guitarist recommend the band?

column2: The salesman who resented the cashier mislabeled the products in the brochure.
column5: Was there an error in the brochure?

column2: The waiter who invited the cook tasted the sauce for the meat.
column5: Did someone sample the meat?

column2: The medic who assisted the doctor borrowed the instrument for the surgery.
column5: Were the medical professionals preparing for an operation?

column2: The passenger who befriended the stewardess remembered the flight across the Atlantic.
column5: Did they recall sailing across the ocean?

column2: The cheerleader who bothered the quarterback attended the game at the college.
column5: Did someone go to a professional game?

column2: The animator who criticized the producer offered a solution to the problem.
column5: Was an answer to the problem given?

column2: The dictator who despised the dissident gave a speech about the protests.
column5: Were there problems in the government?

column2: The physician who the cardiologist consulted checked the files in his office.
column5: Were the files checked in the office?

column2: The babysitter who the parents liked planned a trip to Puerto Rico.
column5: Was someone getting ready for a vacation?

column2: The banker who the chairman informed invested a million in a start-up.
column5: Did someone refuse to invest money?

column2: The violinist who the cellist flattered played a piece from the symphony.
column5: Was the violinist flattered?

column2: The burglar who the policeman wounded reloaded the revolver in a hurry.
column5: Did a burglary take place?

column2: The carpenter who the electrician punched quit the job a week later.
column5: Did the electrician and carpenter get along?

column2: The accountant who the statistician advised calculated the costs of the project.
column5: Were the professionals working together?

column2: The model who the artist approached signed the contract for a year.
column5: Was a multi-year deal involved?

column2: The student who the professor trusted answered the question about the experiment.
column5: Was there a discussion about research?

column2: The mobster who the dealer attacked organized some crimes in New York.
column5: Was the dealer attacked?

column2: The investigator who the cop overheard closed the case without an arrest.
column5: Did someone eventually get convicted?

column2: The actor who the starlet respected forgot the lines during the scene.
column5: Were they getting ready for a music concert?

column2: The defendant who the lawyer misled blamed the system for the conviction.
column5: Was the system ultimately blamed?

column2: The count who the princess adored brought a gift to the reception.
column5: Did someone offer a present?

column2: The bachelor who the socialite pursued owned a company in the area.
column5: Was a break-up about to happen?

column2: The councilman who the secretary kissed covered the expenses for the party.
column5: Was the governor going to pay for the party?

column2: The clerk at the records office clarified the confusing statement on the application.
column5: Was the statement very straightforward?

column2: The handsome prince offered but his bride's family declined the fortune.
column5: Would the prince remain a bachelor?

column2: The two friends wagered their allowance on who would get the highest test score.
column5: Did the friends bet on a baseball game?

column2: The mysterious woman divulged her deepest and darkest secrets to the bus driver.
column5: Was the woman very shy?

column2: The radio newscaster verified the short and exciting report before the broadcast.
column5: Was the report true?

column2: The bargain shopper saw the beautiful and expensive raincoat after the sale was over.
column5: Was the shopper careless with cash?

column2: The exuberant team planned a huge and extravagant party for after the game.
column5: Did the team feel good about things?

column2: The science teacher verified the unexpected results because she found them implausible.
column5: Did the results seem strange?

column2: The temporary assistant saw the short and inappropriate memo while rummaging through the files.
column5: Did the assistant notice the memo?

column2: The injured man imagined the attack while in the emergency room.
column5: Had the man been assaulted?

column2: The worried mother determined the explanation for why her son had been avoiding her.
column5: Was the mother concerned about her son?

column2: The flight attendant clarified the instructions when the passengers asked questions.
column5: Was the flight attendant helpful?

column2: The church workers offered the kids a free bible and some coloring books.
column5: Did the workers offer them food?

column2: The curious girl comprehended the answer but asked the question again.
column5: Did the girl understand the first time?

column2: The office staff raced but there was no clear winner.
column5: Did someone come in first place?

column2: The teacher's assistant divulged the purpose of her colleague's absence.
column5: Did the assistant know the purpose?

column2: Many of the cheerleaders recalled the difficult and strenuous routine from last year's homecoming game.
column5: Did the cheerleaders forget the routine?

column2: The attorneys for the family disputed the authorities' version of what transpired.
column5: Were the events completely agreed upon?

column2: The wealthy investor regretted the bad and unfortunate decision once he realized the consequences.
column5: Was the investor rich?

column2: The models in the fashion show revealed their stylish tank tops.
column5: Were the models wearing sweaters?

column2: The I.R.S. agent demanded the full amount the week following the audit.
column5: Did the audit go well?

column2: The poodle recognized his owner's scent on the clothing that was discovered.
column5: Did the dog have a keen sense of smell?

column2: The waitress promised her regulars a free cup of coffee.
column5: Would the regulars have eggs?

column2: The foreign students sat down but couldn't understand the lecture.
column5: Were the students a bit confused?

column2: The angry mob announced their demands but still refused to negotiate.
column5: Did the mob want to compromise?

column2: The nervous teenager lied to the judge to avoid incriminating his friend.
column5: Did the witness commit perjury?

column2: The bored librarian painted her fingernails after shelving several books.
column5: Was the librarian very busy?

column2: The interior decorator hammered away and hung the painting on the wall.
column5: Did the decorator hang a poster?

column2: The new salesman insulted the stranger and she left the store.
column5: Was the stranger satisfied?

column2: The soccer player kicked the ball through the goalie's hands.
column5: Did the soccer player score?

column2: The thoughtful daughter cared for her elderly mother.
column5: Was the mother taken care of?

column2: The new homeowner slept in the room next to the garden.
column5: Did the homeowner sleep near plants and shrubs?
